body:
The size that an image take in memory is not 1MB, The actual size that an image take in memory can be counted as:

Lets assume you have a image 2000x1250. It needs 4x2000x1250 bytes of memory. Each pixel has a part of red, green, blue and alpha channel information.

So the actual size that would take in memory would be something like 4x2000x1250=10000000 Byte -> 9.5MB

The best way to load the images is using a library, Libraries takes good care of recycling the bitmaps and loading the images, caching them etc.

Here is the collecting of my favorite ones, you can try and use whichever suits your needs. I always prefer the first one.

Glide, Picasso, Fresco
